alert.note: Alert for Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Kleberg Islands; Nueces Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 4:07AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Nueces, south central San Patricio and Kleberg Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 406 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Corpus Christi North Beach to 13 miles west of Malaquite Beach to Riviera. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corpus Christi, Portland, Robstown, Port Aransas, Corpus Christi International Airport, Flour Bluff, Corpus Christi North Beach, Kings Crossing Subdivision, Padre Balli Park, Bay Area Medical Center, Spohn Hospital South, Riviera, Texas A&M University Corpus Christi, Clarkwood, Annaville, Waldron Field, La Palmera Mall, Riviera Beach, Del Mar College Windward Campus and Corpus Christi Country Club. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 1 and 13. US Highway 181 between mile markers 644 and 648. US Highway 77 between mile markers 702 and 708. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for south central Texas.
